poem:
**Golden Powers**

Amidst the rubble of distant lands,  
missiles arc the cold, gray sky.  
Statesmen whisper in hallowed halls,  
shielding treasures with golden hands.  
The cries of past and present—  
a tangled dance of power, sprawls.  
And in Rome, beneath a marble gaze,  
secrets held in shadows lie.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia and Ukraine trade missile attacks after Putin-Trump talks shelved – Europe live 10.53am BST Member states of the European Union (EU) must preserve exclusive jurisdiction on national security matters, the Italian prime minister said on Wednesday, as Rome faces scrutiny from Brussels over its use of special powers to shield strategic assets. Italy is among countries within the bloc that have made extensive use of golden power legislation to protect sectors such as banking,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
